name: Gnotshi on tomato-cream sauce with mozzarella and basil
cookingInstructions: Put tomato paste, tomato pesto and cream in a small pot and let it boil brefly. Afterwards, keep it cooking on the smallest level.
While cutting the fresh cocktail tomatoes into quaters, boil about 2 L of water for the Gnotshis. Don't forget to put salt in the water after it startet boiling.
Cut mozzarella into small pieces and take off the basil lieves from the stalk.
Put the fresh cocktail tomatoes in the sauce and the Gnotshis in the water. The Gnotshis are finished when swimming on the water surface.
When the Gnotshis are ready, pour off the water, spice up the sauce with a pinch of pepper & salt and serve the Gnotshis with sauce as topping. Mozzarella and basil can be added optional.

name: Swabian pockets (Mauldäschle) with eggs
cookingInstructions: Cut the swabian pockets into 4 thick slices.
Fry the swabian pockets in a pan until they are nearly done.
Cut all onions into small pieces and add the normal to the swabian pockets and fry them until the onions are glassy.
Squirl the eggs, milk, spring onions, salt & pepper heavily until the surface is covered with bubbles.
Pure the eggs into the pan with onions and fry everything together until the egg is done.

name: Halloumi Sandwich DELUXE
cookingInstructions: Slice the champignons and onions and fry them in a pan until to the wanted consistency
Slice each halloumi into 4 pieces and fry it in a second pan until it is light brown on both sides.
Cut the french baguett into 4 pieces and those pieces into half (like a sandwich bread). Put 2 leaves of salat and some sclies cucumber on one side of the baguette.
Put 2 slices of halloumi, some champignons and onions on the other side of the baguette and add some curry ketchup and balsamico sauce.
Put both sides together and enjoy the DELUXE sandwich.

name: Maccharoni stracciatella
cookingInstructions: Cut the cocktail tomatoes into half, the garlic into small peaces, half of the basil and mint into small stripes
Boil enough water and cook the maccharoni until they are al dente. Drain off the water and keep it warm if needed.
Put the tomatoes, garlic and olive oil in a pan and fry it until the garlic starts to get briown. Add the basil and mint stripes and stir thoroughly.
Serve the pasta on a plate in the following order: Maccharoni --> Tomatoes --> 50gr of stracciatella/mozzarella --> some of the basil leaves.
Enjoy a fine and easy pasta.
